programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Emily has used all her powers of seduction to get close to Santa Anna. Braving danger at seducing the Mexican leader, she gathers vital intelligence that will prove an indispensable weapon in the Texans' ongoing pursuit of victory. Drama set during the Texas Revolution, starring Cynthia Addai-Robinson.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Animal helper Matt Wright and his team take on a dangerous challenge to ensure the survival of the saltwater crocodile. They must gather more than 20,000 unhatched eggs for relocation, but the fiercely protective reptilian mothers do not take well to their territory being invaded.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit the sites of famous American Civil War battles to unearth valuable and quirky collectibles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank bid for slot machines, old advertising and bears that have been stuffed and mounted.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: The embalmers finally get to grips with a body that has spent the last three years stored in the mortuary, and Marcus prepares a lavish funeral for a local boxer.

programme.title: Grave Trade
programme.desc: John goes to Ghana to check on the funeral home he has set up there, while archaeologists investigate how immigration has shaped British history.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale and the team restore a rusty 1920s tyre-changer, and a baseball game from the 1940s is given an urgent makeover.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team repairs a 1967 dirt-road motorbike, while Tyler and Rick restore an airline flight sign.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds gear up to shoot a new commercial for the store, but the signs are that not everyone will be happy with the final result. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth harbour some serious doubts after Karen brings in a Feng Shui expert in the hope of boosting sales and gaining a positive energy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed AC/DC album and a Beals Model Remington revolver give the team pause for thought. Plus, Rick searches for new ways to publicise the pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is spellbound when a book signed by the great Harry Houdini appears in the shop. Meanwhile, Corey spots an old X-ray unit and Chum takes a vow of silence.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts examine the possibility that life began on Mars and travelled to Earth, and assess the plans aliens may have in store for the human race if they really do exist.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate macabre places associated with death, and question whether otherworldly connections could be responsible for strange disappearances and suicides.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler work on restoring a vending machine, while the rest of the team take on two children's handcar trains.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly oversees the difficult restoration of a 1965 truck, while Ron and Tyler work on a peep show machine from the 1940s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to purchase a page from the Gutenberg Bible, and Corey checks out a rare six-sheet movie poster from the classic Ziegfeld Follies.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey check out an original Superman costume, but it remains to be seen whether the asking price is too much for their budget.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Six lockers belonging to one tenant go up for auction as the buyers speculate over the owner's identity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A bidding war erupts between the buyers as they attend the latest round of auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competing bladesmiths are tasked with forging a bowie knife. Two make it through to the final round where they must recreate a deadly saber called the Shamshir.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed picture of the original Star Trek cast and an Eli Whitney Civil War revolver both pique the Pawn Stars' interest.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts open previously off-limits secret files in a bid to answer some of the most mysterious questions surrounding UFOs and extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A think-tank of top global experts examines whether America's founding fathers hid extra-terrestrial secrets in their documents, buildings and symbols.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee meets Marvel Comics creator Stan Lee to find out if a rare signed comic is the real thing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a Gilded Age train, before a classic Nintendo race car game from the 1960s rolls its way into the shop.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with forging a combat knife from an anti-tank hedgehog, leading to two gruelling rounds of competition filled with frustration and a medical emergency.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: In his Norwich forge, Alec Steele attempts to produce a Kris Blade - an asymmetrical dagger with distinctive blade-patterning.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge, blacksmith Alec Steele tackles the Basket Hilt Rapier, a weapon characterised by a basket-shaped guard to protect the hand..

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Six lockers belonging to one tenant go up for auction as the buyers speculate over the owner's identity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mancunian stand-up Jason Manford hosts the comedy show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, and invites observational comic Michael McIntyre to take to the stage.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A September 2012 edition of the topical comedy quiz show, as guests Greg Davies, Andi Osho and Stewart Francis join host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer their take on the week's news stories.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton and stand-up and actress Cariad Lloyd joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Katy Brand, Ian Stone, Jack Dee and Lou Sanders, as they chat about chocolate, bomb scares and stag nights.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined by Dave Johns, Lucy Porter, Gemma Cairney and Reece Shearsmith to discuss weird celebrity encounters and good neighbours.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Chaos ensues on the Saturday night shift in Stoke-on-Trent, while Rich makes a disturbing discovery in Uttoxeter. Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a couple who have been collecting unusual items since the 1960s, and Danielle brings a rare scooter into the garage.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori are anxious to see what is inside a locked coffin, but a rival thwarts their plans.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The competing bidders aim to win two speciality items at auction, including a six-ton trailer. Reality series following a group of rival lock-up enthusiasts.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find a flying saucer, while Frank makes a gamble on a vintage set of wheels.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a museum in Louisiana dedicated to Bonnie and Clyde, and examine a roadie's collection of valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson subjects the Skoda Yeti to a thorough examination, while Richard Hammond charts the evolution of the Porsche 911 by pitting a modern Turbo S cabriolet against its oldest relative the Volkswagen Beetle - and the power of gravity. James May takes the Ariel Atom V8 for a spin on the test track, and comedian John Bishop receives tuition from the Stig before getting behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Suspicions are raised when a routine x-ray reveals suspicious packages hidden inside the tyres of a pick-up truck. Officers also seize a large shipment of marijuana.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: The owner of a trucking company comes to Steve looking for a vintage ride, but Steve faces an uphill battle meeting his demands for a 1930's era cab.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Albania to test three luxury vehicles - the Rolls-Royce Ghost, Bentley Mulsanne and Mercedes-Benz S65 AMG. Jeremy also drives three high-performance hatchbacks in the form of the limited-edition Ford Focus RS500, Prodrive-developed Cosworth Impreza STi CS400 and one-off Volvo C30 PPC. Jonathan Ross is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May shop for second-hand convertibles, uncovering the pitfalls to avoid when buying a used car, and Jeremy also gets the opportunity to test-drive the Pagani Zonda R. Actor Simon Pegg takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and actor Nigel Havers, while Lee Mack teams up with writer and comedian Charlie Brooker and actress Nina Wadia, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mancunian stand-up Jason Manford hosts the comedy show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, and invites observational comic Michael McIntyre to take to the stage.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets Aisling Bea, Bob Mortimer, Mark Watson, Nish Kumar and Sally Phillips brilliantly bewildering tasks, including basketball without hands.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Phil Kay and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including birds, bills and brothers in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects including beetles and baguettes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the International Space Station, revealing the influence of an unconventional aircraft designer and a 19th-century rebreather.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates conflicting accounts of the killing of Italian dictator Benito Mussolini in 1945.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction and maintenance of the International Space Station, revealing the influence of an unconventional aircraft designer and a 19th-century rebreather.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The remains of three U-boats discovered in the Bristol Channel. Their exact identity and how they came to be there is not known, so divers explore the wrecks and with the help of British and German experts reveal the mystery submarines. Series investigating deep-sea wrecks off the south-west coast of England.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history, beginning with a man from Bermondsey who vanished without trace in 1849.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, trainee Claire Oates takes her driving test, while chef Alex and manager Michelle prepare a dinner for 130 people on the East Lancashire railway.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the East Lancashire Railway, the annual Race the Train event gets under way - with athletes of all abilities taking on the 11-mile course from Bury to Rawtenstall.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor ends his journey by learning to drive a stunt car, sampling Hollywood luxury in an executive jet, cruising in a 1950s hot rod and taking an aerial tour.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy sketches, including Wedding Service and Done to Death. With guests Diane Keen and Sue Lloyd, and music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy sketches, including Done to Death. With music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. First part of the crime drama's two-part final story, starring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Peasant girl Tess Durbeyfield is encouraged by her father to seek advancement with their supposed relatives, the wealthy D'Urbervilles, and meets the charming Alec, man of the house since his father's death. He showers her with attention and gifts, promising her family will want for nothing - but as she soon discovers to her cost, there's a dark side to her persistent new suitor. Thomas Hardy adaptation, starring Gemma Arterton, Hans Matheson, Ian Puleston-Davies and Anna Massey.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron's work at the German PoW camp brings him into conflict with one of the prisoners, while Janet fears Dr Finlay's affection for a married patient could jeopardise his career. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Wealthy widow Alice Costigan invites Robert to stay at her country house for a spot of pheasant shooting, filling him with high hopes of romance. However, he's not the only one vying for her affections, and when her nephew falls ill she snubs him by turning to his rival for help. Victorian medical drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder, Maureen Beattie and Andrew Connolly.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: As the regiment prepares to leave for the South Atlantic to defend Deliverance Island, Andy contemplates proposing, and Sarah and Jeremy's relationship begins to crumble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's a difficult day for Yvonne as she faces up to the fact that she was wrong to throw Shirley out of the house. However, the youngster eventually accepts her apology and it looks as if, once she has pulled through this latest mishap, the kindly PC will be able to get her life back on track - until fate deals a terrible blow. Meanwhile, with the tensions in his relationship with Andrea beginning to take their toll, Neil is devastated at the news that she has been critically injured. He turns up at the hospital, only to be faced by Smithy, having already filled his shoes. Lance finally accepts Mark's proposal of marriage after a long day of deliberation, while Gina is surprised to catch a glimpse of Irene Radford. She is convinced her eyes are deceiving her - until Jack confides in her that Sun Hill's crime matriarch is indeed back. Michele Austin, Andrew Lancel, Simon Rouse, Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham and Stefan Booth star.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Mark decides to leave when he realises neither Tricia nor Chrissie want him around - but an encounter with a patient could change their minds. Donna applies for a bar job, and persuades Mickie to lie to the manager about her experience. Mubbs gets a wake-up call when Owen decides not to let him be best man, and Sean offers to stand by Jess.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark and George treat a youngster who has suffered an epileptic fit, while in something of a quandary having spent the night together. A family dispute culminates in a reckless car chase and horrific crash, while Baz misses Charlie's presence.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat is determined not to let Frank stand in the way of her independence - but Ricky pays the price. Michelle is on tenterhooks as she awaits the results of her exams.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark is in for a shock.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A drug war leads to a fire in a block of flats in a nearby estate. Meanwhile, Sicknote gives a public speech which leads to him receiving a standing ovation.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A friend who runs a fairground asks Lovejoy to sell silver candlesticks on his behalf, but the police arrive and reveal they are stolen property. Jimmy Jewel and Phil Daniels guest star, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Animal rights activists free a group of monkeys, one of which is carrying a lethal and contagious virus, so Jim tries to contain the infection before Jersey is struck by an epidemic. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Grandad receives a valuable present from Jack and Adrian for his 75th birthday, while Joey is reunited with his long-lost dog.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Spooner reveals unexpected musical abilities - and the rest of the staff, astonished to discover he has any talent at all, insist on cashing in on his chart success. Mike Berry, John Inman, Frank Thornton, Wendy Richard and Mollie Sugden star in the final episode of the long-running shopfloor comedy, which features a guest appearance by former Crimewatch presenter Nick Ross.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: A Hollywood producer arrives in town, full of big ideas about filming one of Lionel's books - but his plan to use authentic locations is met with disapproval. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo investigate the murder of a solicitor in a sleepy Yorkshire village, but grumpy detective Dalziel finds himself personally involved when a letter addressed to him is discovered among the victim's belongings. Drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives.

credits.actor: Colin Buchanan as the chalk-and-cheese detectives

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A dying man asks the team to clear the name of his son, a talented junior golfer who committed suicide after being implicated in the murder of a 10-year-old boy. Aiding the investigation is a former chief superintendent who admits she always had doubts about the teenager's guilt, but the committee members of the exclusive golf club where the victim's body was discovered prove reluctant to help the officers with their inquiries. Isla Blair and Cherie Lunghi guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A dying man's last desperate answerphone message confuses the police and hampers their investigation into his murder. Adding to the air of mystery surrounding the case, it also sets his son off on a nightmare journey. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus, James Macpherson, Blythe Duff, Iain Anders, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura travels to Edinburgh to try to uncover the truth behind Andrew's wife's death, but finds more than she bargained for. Meanwhile, tensions between Tom and Katy reach breaking point as their secret threatens to surface. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's resolve to bring Andrew to justice deepens and she enlists Tom's help in her plan. However, when a deception in her personal life comes to light, she is left with no one to turn to and resorts to dangerous methods to force Andrew's confession. But she is not alone in her mission. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt, Ioan Gruffudd and Warren Brown.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five workmates answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Martin, Lucy, Haroon and Karen pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona is determined to uncover the truth, David is left worried, and Tracy goes on a date.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff is fuming when his trick does not work, and Maria explains to Liam she has lost the baby. When a dishevelled Nina calls in at the cafe. Roy's pleased to see her while Carla is concerned.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer more advice to viewers, looking at whether people could be owed tax back on their PPI claims and comparing child savings accounts to find out which are the best bets.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tim is surprised to see his dad can't see the funny side over the botched trick, and Gary assures Maria that he wants to be with her, baby or not. Steve and Tracy decide it's time to be honest with each other, and Sarah warns Bethany to tread carefully after sleeping with Daniel.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: A chance encounter gives Pete a boost, whileJenny faces fresh heartbreak and Karenattempts to make amends with her mother. David starts his new venture, but soon realises that all is not as it seems.John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the royals' rollercoaster relationship with the press, beginning with the Queen's 1953-1954 Commonwealth tour, when cameramen worked hand-in-hand with the palace. A few years later, newspaper owner Lord Altrincham was attacked for daring to publish criticisms of the Queen, but by the mid-1970s Princess Margaret's hedonistic lifestyle was the subject of increasing press attention. But that was only the beginning. In the 1990s, the press has a field day over the breakdown of Charles and Diana's marriage, feeding on royal scandals.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The investigators are given a chance to explore a mysterious Nazi complex in the Argentinean jungle, and head to Berlin to examine evidence that Hitler could have faked his death.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The treasure hunters discovers more artefacts, leading ever closer to a valuable find. Plus, they meet a local historian who warns them that their objective has a cursed past.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his three Ferraris, a 1971 Daytona Coupe and a 1972 Dino GT to the Amelia Island auction.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Vehicle restorer Wayne Carini looks out for a BMW Isetta for his newly married daughter at the Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum sale.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage demonstrates what happens when a dog gets behind the wheel. Plus, rowdy races gone wrong, and an incredible dance-off on the highway.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A magnesium fire results in a huge explosion, an F-18 fighter jet crashes on an aircraft carrier, and a motorcycle stunt ends in a spectacular crash.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An F-14 Tomcat explodes over the ocean, wind causes a pair of hydro-boats to crash, and a record-breaking car jump ends with the vehicle splitting in two.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp mum and Sunday school teacher Sarah's first car - a 1965 Buick Skylark Convertible.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the alcoholic spirit aquavit is made, and how kangaroos help protect motorcycle riders in a crash. Plus, a look at the cleaning of New York's St Patrick's Cathedral.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure purple.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The opilio crab season begins again, and inexperienced fishermen prepare themselves for their introduction to the sub-zero temperatures on board ship in the icy waters of the Bering Sea.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: It is the start of the season, and the treasure hunters search for gold on the seabed of Nome, Alaska.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell faces trial by fire as he hauls a mobile building down a load-destroying track. Truck driver Jacko rushes a monster load - and a worried passenger - to a big show.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: A good client brings in a problematic 1965 Mustang, expecting Noah and his crew to transform this twisted shell of a car and into a beast on the track.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Official documents shed light on NASA's secret 'plan B', put in place in case the first moon landing failed, and the Cassini mission unravels a 300-year-old mystery.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: In Victoria, a crack team races to build the state's VLocity trains of the future. Slippery tracks and kangaroos throw a 5,000-tonne coal train off its path to port.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A major storm arrives days into the opilio crab fishing season, bringing high seas and causing the captain of the Time Bandit to order his men to abandon their posts - moments before a wave crashes across the deck.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Summer storms keep the miners off the water, which causes them to lose valuable time. Meanwhile, Zeke proves he was not claim-jumping, but ends up getting shut down any way.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a north London emporium full of antique shop fittings that will surprise. Then, Drew and Tee visit a Second World War hospital museum in Suffolk.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: The Mackay Brothers hit the bush and try to dodge destruction. Steve takes on an old enemy at the worst time of year and Bumpa Farrell struggles for power on an epic hay convoy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV in the south of France. However, with age comes problems, and expert mechanic Edd China needs to strip it back to its bare bones to breathe new life into the vehicle, as almost every aspect of the quirky car requires attention.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 19th-century Bradford weaving mill, where he discovers industrial trolleys and containers. In Cheshire, he visits a manor house mentioned in the Domesday book.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: A cyclone threatens tanker driver Michael's delivery of hazardous chemicals to a desert mine site. Meanwhile, Tasmanian trucker Lindsay transports 80,000 angry bees to a rainforest.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains must make hard choices as Typhoon Nuri closes in. The Northwestern charges into the storm, while the Cape Caution retreats to land.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how some farms are run with the help of robots, how a machine picks up 30 tons of logs in a single grab, and how the world's most valuable pianos are transported.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How towering scaffolds are built from giant poles of bamboo, and how people mine for the mineral that makes fireworks burn red.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: JT is almost 900lbs with a 100-lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases unravelled by forensic examiners, including the discovery of a woman's decapitated body by a fisherman and a reported suicide involving a toxic liquid.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: In a bizarre case apparently inspired by a TV show, an Illinois man commits a murder and fakes his own death in an attempt to cash in on his own life insurance policy.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 62-year-old Narleen Campton, who was found murdered in her home, apparently having been tortured, during Thanksgiving 2011 in Newport, Washington. Though Jeremy Bryant confessed to his involvement, doubt remains over whether he acted alone.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The trail of bank robbers who leave bombs at the scene of their crimes leads investigators to believe they are motivated by something other than money.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: Officers are confronted by an angry dog owner brandishing a shotgun and an agent has to find an aggressive pit bull.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown gets hands-on with an angry alligator, a dehydrated puppy struggles, Lucky the cat swallows a large amount of human medication and a parrot is involved in a love triangle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides from Baltimore come to the bridal store for a joint appointment - but they have very different ideas, while new fashion director Randy is ready to make his mark.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant girl Ashley wants a completely new look, although her family is not keen on the idea, while rodeo queen Becky wants to stand out.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride chooses between two different styles of dress, while a customer wants a beaded gown with a lot of flashy decoration thrown in.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Pluto the singing dog is having problems with his voice, causing concern for Dr Chris. Tim tackles a territorial Tasmanian Devil, and can Lisa save a desperately ill kitten?.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigators join forces with Texas police officers in an attempt to break up one of the biggest dog-fighting rings in American history.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The officers respond to a call at a livery stable and find themselves battling to save the life of a badly neglected horse.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with Kev Paxton and Anthony Devine helping her transform a cooker hood, a sofa and a collection of jars.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How murder investigation experts reconstruct crimes from the remains of burnt evidence when the body of the victim has yet to be identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Amy Bradley, who vanished in March 1998 while on a family cruise through the Caribbean. Her disappearance came after a night out dancing in the ship's disco.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tyarra Williams, who vanished in January 2016. Tips suggested the 19-year-old frm North Carolina may have fallen prey to human trafficking.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I'll Know It When I See It
programme.desc: Brooke is looking for a special gown - it has to be unique and she won't settle for anything else. Unfortunately, nothing seemingly lives up to her expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nikasha wants to look like a grown woman on her wedding day, but her father would like her to appear the way she did on her sixteenth birthday.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Cindy and her mother hope to find a big, regal ball gown, and are surprised when her sister and best friend fly in from Miami.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kandice is worried her custom-made gown may not be all she had hoped for, while money is no object for Aleshia as she seeks the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing seven stone, Stephanie wants to show off her new figure in a sexy wedding dress, while Akisha worries her outfit will not impress her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: If You've Got It, Flaunt It
programme.desc: Embracing her height, pro-basketball player Kia looks for a long dress to complement her six-inch heels.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Aspiring country music star Whitney Duncan wants a romantic lace gown that gives her some curves, while a bride with a larger-than-life personality looks for a dress to match.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having tried on 100 gowns, Lisa is still looking for her ideal outfit, while Brittany is determined to wear pink on her big day.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a north London emporium full of antique shop fittings that will surprise. Then, Drew and Tee visit a Second World War hospital museum in Suffolk.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages three items from a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with Kev Paxton and Anthony Devine helping her transform a cooker hood, a sofa and a collection of jars.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben takes a trip to Blackpool to meet up with fellow make-up artist, friend and reality star Charlotte Dawson, daughter of Les Dawson. They discuss being trolled online.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: The family is going to LA, but for Reuben its part-holiday and part-work. On the trip, Reuben meets up with Nicolette Grey to film a social media post.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The Browns go on a spring holiday by taking a trip down Route 66, but being cooped up together leads to tension between the wives.

programme.title: Raising Tourette's
programme.desc: Charlee and her mum want answers after her collapse in the park. Kristin prepares for the next chapter in her life, and chaos ensues when Kaden's dad is in charge..

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Investigators unravel a tale of adultery and greed as they try to solve the case of a family man murdered at a shopping centre 15 years earlier.
